servinfo.title: N → “R” time lag exceeds specification
servinfo.ptxt: This test is to check conditions of clutch, reverse brake and fluid pressure. “Time lag” means time elapsed since select lever is shifted with engine idling till shock is felt.

s1.ptxt: With chocks placed before and behind front and rear wheels respectively, depress brake pedal.
With stop watch ready, shift select lever from “N” to “D” range and measure time from that moment till shock is felt.
Similarly measure time lag by shifting select lever from “N” to “R” range.

item.ptxt: When repeating this test, be sure to wait at least one minute after select lever is shifted back to “N” range.
Engine should be warmed up fully for this test.
Repeat test 3 times and take average of those data for final time lag data.

ps.ptxt: Malfunction of pressure control solenoid valve (Low line pressure)

action.ptxt: Inspect. If NG, replace valve body assembly.

ps.ptxt: Malfunction of primary regulator valve (Low line pressure)
Leakage from “R” range fluid pressure circuit

action.ptxt: Overhaul or replace valve body assembly.
